How the Republican health care bill would change tax credits from Obamacare

Both the Affordable Care Act and the GOP-proposed American Health Care Act offer tax credits to help pay for health care. The ACA offers credits based on age, income and cost of insurance, while the GOP plan would give flat tax credits based on age, phasing out for people who earn $75,000 or greater. Under the GOP proposal, middle-class earners would see greater assistance, while many older and lower-income earners will see their federal aid decrease.

Using data from the Kaiser Family Foundation, these maps show how the existing ACA tax credits would change for Texans if Congress adopts the GOP’s replacement plan. Kaiser didn’t include cost-sharing assistance in the analysis.

  • Decrease
  • Increase
  • $3K+
  • $3K
  • $2K
  • $1K
  • No change
  • $1K
  • $2K
  • $3K
  • $3K+
